entries.title: Announcing: the Perl Nerd Merit Badge contest
entries.text: Would you like to win a PErl Nerd Badge with a Velociraptor on it? You only have to write an article for Perltricks site and submit it before February 21, 2014.

entries.title: Exceptions in Perl, Then and Now
entries.text: Should one use the Error and Error::Simple modules for exceptions?

entries.title: Perl Catalyst "Runner" Development Release 5 on CPAN
entries.text: John Napiorkowski describes what is in this release. As a Catalyst user it is very importat that you check out thise release and make sure your application works with this as well.

entries.title: NIST opens up atoms with open source
entries.text: Introducing Demeter which is a scientific software for the processing and analysis of XAS data built using Perl, wxWidgets, Gnuplot, and other open source technologies.

entries.title: Perl and Me, Part 8: Endless Forms Most Beautiful and Most Wonderful
entries.text: Buddy Burden continous exploring his relationship to Perl. This time he discusses the need for the language to change and evolve.

entries.title: Maintaining Perl 5: Grant Report for Month 5
entries.text: The report of Tony Cook - Approximately 30 tickets were worked on, and 10 patches were applied.

entries.title: Why installing Dist::Zilla is slow and what you can do about it
entries.text: David Golden checked the worst-case scenario, when you have a freshly installed perl and you need to install Dist::Zilla with more than 170 dependencies and suggests two ways to reduce the install-time. Even with those it will probably take more than 10 minutes. Just enought to do get up from your chair and do some exercies.

entries.title: Announcing Pinto 0.099
entries.text: CPAN Is like A Box of Chocolates. Pinto is a powerful tool for creating and managing a private chocolate box.

entries.title: Downloading age-restricted videos from YouTube
entries.text: Curtis Brandt used WWW::YouTube::Download to download videos from YouTube, but had an issue with the ones where age limit was set. He solved it.

entries.title: Randomness and statistical concepts
entries.text: This is strictly for people who understand statistics, or who want to understand it! Sinan Unur explains why the statements of Ovid when using random dice rolls, were incorrect.

entries.title: Chomp and $/, the Input Record Separator
entries.text: 'Chomp removes the trailing newline of a string.' says the common sense, but does it? What does chomp really do? And what is $/?

entries.title: Constructor and accessors in classic Perl OOP
entries.text: While in new Perl applications you might prefer to use Moo or Moose, but there are plenty of cases when classic Perl OOP is needed. For example when you need to maintain an existing application. This is the first article of a series of articles explaining the core Perl OOP.

entries.title: Perl based open source products
entries.text: A list of open source, Perl based product that you can use, and even help develop.

chapters.title: Events
chapters.header: I usually list the next 3-4 events here. The list of all the events can be found on the web site. If your Perl event is not listed there, please let me know.
